DOC.brief_summary: Objective : To assess accuracy transcutaneous bilirubin ( TcB ) measurement neonate , relation gestational age ( GA ) , time ( postnatal hour ) site ( forehead , sternum , knee ) measurement . Hypothesis : Using ( combine ) different site TcB determination might improve accuracy TcB relation time measurement GA neonate . Methods : The study include neonate > 32 week ' gestation care well-baby nursery NICU University Hospital Patras , September December 2011 . Data sex , gestational age , gestation perinatal information , mother 's infant 's ABO group Rh , G6PD deficiency , Coombs test , type delivery complication , birthweight , postnatal medication intervention , type volume feeding , extension jaundice , collect . TcB measurement perform use BiliCheck bilirubinometer ( accord standard protocol ) 3 different site : forehead , sternum knee . Total serum bilirubin ( TSB ) value obtain use heel stick technique , measurement perform direct spectrophotometric device ( Unistat bilirubinometer , Richert , Depew , NY ) . The accuracy device validate previously . TSB measurement perform within 5 minute TcB measurement . At occasion TcB measurement ( 3 ) , correspond TSB value , time measurement ( postnatal hour ) , actual weight note . Statistics : The agreement TcB TSB value assess use Bland-Altman % method . The independent joint effect GA time measurement bias evaluate multivariate regression analysis .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Born University Hospital Patras 2 . GA > 32 week 3 . Parental consent participate 1 . Under phototherapy 2 . Congenital infection 3 . Chromosomal abnormality 4 . Congenital abnormality 5 . Hepatic dysfunction
